data.title: Nancy Lepp Weds Brooks Robertson
data.text:
Nancy Mary Lepp and James Brooks Ayres Robertson 4th were married yesterday at Trinity Episcopal Church in Southport, Conn. The Rev. Alastair Votaw performed the ceremony, assisted by the Rev. Walter C. Orlowski, a Roman Catholic priest, and the Rev. Erik Kolbel, a Congregational minister.

Mrs. Robertson is a daughter of Joanne D. Lepp and Joseph R. Lepp, both of Manassas, Va. The bridegroom is the son of the late Mr. and Mrs. Robertson of Washington.

The bride, who attended the State University at Albany, is a fashion designer in New York. Her father, who is retired, was a lieutenant colonel in the Marine Corps. Her mother is a sales agent for Long & Foster, a real-estate company in Manassas.

The bridegroom, who is known as Brooks, is a writer. He is a graduate of St. Albans School and Brown University. His mother, Margret E. Robertson, was a Foreign Service officer. His father was the director of the Washington office of the Oklahoma City architectural firm of Hudgins, Thompson & Ball.
